title: Spanish Wine Shop Sign
content:
A little help on this sign shot from bus in Spain

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SpainishWineShop_4665.jpg)

Font: 

 GRENADIE 

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SpainishWineShop.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510/http:/typophile.com/files/SpainishWineShop.jpg) | 224.59 KB |
author: bojev

comments.content:
I didn't spot a font that matched these Spanish wine shop letters.  
Here is a somewhat similar font of about the right stroke thickness based on lettering found on buildings constructed in Spain's Andalucian region in the 1930's and 1940's. John Chippindale's Avenida

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Avenida_A-M_5050.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Avenida_N-Z_5276.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Avenida_lc_a-m_6592.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Avenida_lc_n-z_5436.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/avenida/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/avenida/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/avenida/")  
Many other Art Deco fonts, but none that I saw get much closer.  
Don

Duh! I just found it - a font called Grenadie, by our own Old Nick  
 [http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=grenadier&text=Wine+%26+Gourmet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417034510/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?q=grenadier&text=Wine+%26+Gourmet "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=grenadier&text=Wine+%26+Gourmet")

Nick has been a one man font factory and has produced a real digital treasury of interesting designs.  
Don
